definition: to be in a tangle/to nag
to gather together/to investigate/to entangle/to correct
to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy

sentences.english: Then reality becomes a perfect model that the order of all the forms entangles in integration.
sentences.chinese: 现实也变成了所有纠缠于一体的形式秩序的完美模型。

sentences.english: Then we propose the protocol of teleportation of Milburn via such quantum states.
sentences.chinese: 然后以上述量子态作为纠缠资源讨论了隐形传态方案。

sentences.english: Dryer, which makes your fine hair full and tangly .
sentences.chinese: 烘干机，使您的氄充分和纠缠。

sentences.english: It was only a fancy; yet a fancy will sometimes be importunate.
sentences.chinese: 它只是一个幻梦，但是有时幻梦是会纠缠不休的。

sentences.english: One can no longer walk the streets without seeing beggars importuning passers by.
sentences.chinese: 走在街上总能看到乞丐纠缠行人乞讨。

sentences.english: It a lot, and it has some tricks up its sleave.
sentences.chinese: 了很多，它已成立了纠缠一团的一些技巧。

sentences.english: We considered the issue of using the multiparticle entanglement into remote preparation of quantum states.
sentences.chinese: 研究了利用多体量子纠缠进行远程态制备的问题。

sentences.english: Anthony wheedled. He badgered. He pouted. "Where would you get them?"
sentences.chinese: 安东尼开始花言巧语，继而纠缠不休，最后撅起了嘴。

sentences.english: For years uncle tom had avoided emotional entanglements.
sentences.chinese: 好多年来汤姆叔叔一直避免感情上的纠缠。

sentences.english: MAR is a participant in the national whale disentanglement network.
sentences.chinese: 三月是一个在全国鲸鱼退纠缠网络参与者。

sentences.english: One of Iran's only high-profile female filmmakers, she is forever tangling with the government.
sentences.chinese: 她是伊朗唯一高姿态的女性导演，从不与政府纠缠。

sentences.english: Unhardened webs can be destroyed by marines walking through them without causing the player to get entangled.
sentences.chinese: 淬硬网，可摧毁海军陆战队穿过他们造成球员纠缠。

sentences.english: Why do plaques and tangles form?
sentences.chinese: 为什么会产生斑块和纠缠？

sentences.english: They have concealed their tangled grievances.
sentences.chinese: 掩藏着他们纠缠的幽怨。

definition: to mix with others/to socialize/to deal with/to contend
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
to intertwine/to band together (with)/to link up (with)/twisted/tangled/confused/to be at a loss
lit. two segments with a single cut (idiom)/fig. to make a clean break (idiom)
to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
